concise_definition: n. 伪装, 假象, 骗局; v. 伪装, 欺骗

definitions.explanation_en: Something that is fake, fraudulent, or intended to deceive others by pretending to be genuine or legitimate.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指伪装成真实或合法之物的虚假事物，其目的是欺骗他人。
definitions.example_en: The so-called miracle cure was just a sham designed to take money from desperate patients.
definitions.example_cn: 所谓的神奇疗法只是一个骗局，目的是从绝望的患者身上骗钱。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who pretends to have qualities, beliefs, or feelings they do not actually possess, especially to gain approval or advantage.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指假装拥有自己并不具备的品质、信念或情感，以获取认可或利益的人。
definitions.example_en: He's a sham — he talks about integrity but constantly cuts corners.
definitions.example_cn: 他是个伪君子——嘴上谈正直，实际上却总是走捷径。

definitions.explanation_en: To deceive or mislead someone by pretending to be something one is not, or by feigning a particular quality or emotion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过假装成自己并非真实的身份，或伪装某种品质或情感，来欺骗或误导他人。
definitions.example_en: She shammed illness to avoid going to work.
definitions.example_cn: 她假装生病以逃避上班。

comparison.analysis: “Fraud” (欺诈) 是法律术语，强调通过欺骗手段非法获取利益，通常涉及金钱或权利，具有明确的违法性。而 “sham” 更侧重于形式上的虚假和伪装，不一定构成法律犯罪，但同样具有欺骗性。
“Pretense” (假装) 指掩饰真实情况或情感的行为，常用于描述个人层面的虚伪，语气较温和。而 “sham” 更强烈，暗示系统性、有目的的欺骗，常带有贬义和道德谴责。
“Charade” (闹剧/做戏) 指一种公开的、往往荒谬的伪装行为，通常带有讽刺意味，强调其荒诞和不真实感。而 “sham” 更强调欺骗的意图和结果，不一定具有表演性质。
